page.title: 15St.Peter's Church,Elwick.
page.content: Elwick church is named after Saint Peter. It is an old Norman church built on even older foundations. It is probably built on an old Saxon defensive settlement. Built in to the walls are two Saxon religious stone carvings. One is of Adam and Eve and the other is the head of a Saxon cross. The existing church was started in 1195 and the last major alterations were done in the early nineteenth century,when the tower was heightened. Recently a reconditioned church organ was put in at a cost of about Â£4,500. Last year the church tower was in such a bad state of repair that Â£40,000 had to be raised to repair the tower. The church is separated now from the village by a deep ghyll. It is likely that the existing village grew up in the middle ages,long after the church was built.
